summary: This appears to be an FBI 302 interview summary or trial preparation memo dated June 22, 2021. It details a witness's recollections regarding interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including the ages of girls brought to Epstein's house, Maxwell's behavior, and specific incidents like a birthday call allegedly from Michael Jackson. The document is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Jeff' or 'JE'; the central figure whose house the witness and other girls visited for appointments. The witness describes the frequency of visits and financial transactions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to by her last name 'Maxwell'. The witness describes her as 'handsy, rude, and domineering' and notes an incident where a girl was upset after seeing her.

persons.name: Michael Jackson
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a birthday call. The witness recalls someone claiming to be Michael Jackson called to wish a girl a happy 16th birthday after Epstein asked about her favorite singer.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as being involved in bringing girls to Epstein's house and her behavior there, indicating a close operational association.
Epstein allegedly facilitated a birthday call from someone claiming to be Michael Jackson to a girl after asking her who her favorite singer was.

events.title: Birthday Call from Michael Jackson
events.description: A girl received a phone call from someone claiming to be Michael Jackson to wish her a happy 16th birthday, allegedly arranged after Jeffrey Epstein asked her who her favorite singer was.

events.title: Witness's First Cocaine Use
events.description: The witness recalls first using cocaine around 2003 or 2004 and speculates they may have used money from Jeffrey Epstein to obtain it, though they more clearly recall buying ecstasy with his money.

events.title: Girls' Visits to Epstein's House
events.description: The witness describes the pattern of a girl's visits to Jeffrey Epstein's house, starting every two weeks, increasing to weekly, and then to a couple times a week, including appointments where she would bring other girls.

events.title: Package from New York
events.description: A few days after overhearing a phone conversation stating Epstein was in Paris and would send something to make up for lost income, the witness received a package from a New York address containing lingerie and a movie.

keyFacts: A witness recalls an incident where someone claiming to be Michael Jackson called to wish a girl a happy 16th birthday, a call allegedly facilitated by Jeffrey Epstein.
The witness describes Ghislaine Maxwell's demeanor at Epstein's house as 'handsy, rude, and domineering'.
The document details a pattern of underage girls visiting Epstein's house, with visit frequency increasing over time and girls being recruited to bring other girls.

Financial connections are suggested, including Epstein sending a package with lingerie and a movie to compensate for lost income during his absence and the witness using money from Epstein to buy drugs.
The witness states that the girls brought by a recruiter 'did not look 18 years old' and appeared to be 16 or 17.
